result.execSummary:
The defendant Dustin M. Macheska was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Dustin M. Macheska is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Dustin M. Macheska was found guilty of Receiving Stolen Property >$5000 - $10,000 or Firearm, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(bm).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dustin M. Macheska

records.addlTxt: Discharge Regular

03:30 PM Defendant Dustin M. Macheska in court via phobne.   Agent Craig Thies appeared for DOC.  Court - owes $518, scheduled to get off probation in less than two weeks.   Defendant indicates he can get that paid in the next day or two.  If not paid by January 8, 2021 court may extend probation or enter civil judgment.  3:33 p.m.
1 year or until all court obligations have been met
Order Extending Probation  1 year
Probation review hearing on December 22, 2020 at 03:20 pm.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: from Judge Boles to Probation/Parole Agent's letter " Mr. Mascheska shall be released today".
from Probation/Parole Agent Theis asking for Defendant to be released on 8/9/19 as Minnesota has accepted his case and he has approved reporting instruction.

03:37 PM Defendant Dustin M. Macheska in court, in custody.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agent Craig Theis in court for DOC.    Theis recommends 45 day sanction, PC Jail with no home monitoring, would be turned back over to MN probation.   Froelich in agreement.  Court addresses Mr. Macheska.  Macheska addresses the court and requests less time so he does not lose his job.  Possibly be on home monitoring to keep his job.  Court addresses Agent Theis.  Court orders sanction of 45 days in jail starting July 18, 2019 but may be released sooner if Agent Theis gets probation arranged with Minnesota.   3:44 p.m.

from Probation/Parole Craig Theis requesting 45 days incarceration without home monitoring, beginning on 7/18/19 to allow the Dept time to transfer case back to Minnesota and to serve as punitive sanction for Defendant's decision to abscond.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on July 31, 2019 at 03:30 pm.
Pierce County DNA Proof of Submission

records.addlTxt: Associated with Charge #1

11:27  Defendant Dustin M. Macheska in court with attorney Alex Stormont.  William Harold Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plead to Ct 1 of the information. Dism Ct 2 & 3. Probation 3 yrs. 90 day cond jail with Huber No Contact with  ThomasCatra No possession or consumption of alcohol or drugs.   Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def  Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights  DEF PLEADS GUILTY to Ct 1 of the information.   COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS  The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty of Ct 1 of the information. Cts 2 & 3 are dismissed. Court orders - S/W Probation 3 years.  Cond: Court Costs, 45 days cond.  jail to be severed on work release. The defendant will report to the Pierce County Jail on Feb 8, 2018 at 10:00 AM  Defendant must report to jail tod to sign up for the home monitoring.  Home Monitoring  can be used for any treatment and aftercare and to attend AAA meetings as well as work.   Comply with the conditions set by agent. No contact with Thomas Catra.   No consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs allowed. May only have the prescribed amount of prescription drugs.DNA Sample     Sentence will be completed on March 25, 2018.

1:58  Defendant Dustin M. Macheska in court.  Sean E Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant states he has Cheryl Warren as an attorney who is not present at this time.  Break for the defendant to contact the attorney. 2:11  Back on the record. No contact with the attorney Foelich requests that the case be continued. Defendant wants to do treatment in Malibu CA. Has been admitted to a program out there and would leave today. Defendant provides the court with his admittance paperwork which came to him via email on his phone.   Bond is amended Conbditions-   Defendant is to enroll and complete the treatment program at Bridges Recovery Center.   No consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs allowed.
